Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2013 03:04PM katyand4 wrote: I'm in Mass. and my doc doesn't scan. We go with if I have a symptom which initially I wasn't to happy with but I've learned to live with it and listen to my body. But the doc and I have developed a relationship such that if I do say I have a pain she would order the scans. Kinda crazy how each doctor is different.
Posts.Title: east coast doctors fredntan Janetanned

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2013 04:40AM katyand4 wrote: I'm in Mass but near NH border so my oncologist doc is in NH. Love her but she does not do scans and while I can understand her reasoning I'm not crazy about it. We do blood work and she checks the CA 15-3 markers each time. I have developed a good relationship with her and have learned to live by the two-three week rule of thumb if something hurts but I will also say she knows I'm not a complainer so if I say something is not right or has been hurting she will order the scans.
Posts.Title: east coast doctors fredntan Janetanned

Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2012 07:55PM - edited Mar 28, 2012 07:56PM by katyand4 Having a tough time lately too.  Love my hubby and family but at the end of the day they just don't get it.  Tonight was particularily bad night....treated myself to way more than a few Miller Lites and now I'm mad at myself. Everything in my body screams that more than one drink for you is very bad but I did it anyways.  I just get to the point where i feel like I could do everything right and still have a reoccurence.  How the heck are we supposed to live like this..it just sucks.  Most of the time I'm doing pretty good then bam not so good.   How can I look to future when just making it thru the present is so difficult.

Posts.Content: katyand4 wrote: Hopefully you don't mind me posting here.  I am usually on the stage 111 boards but my mom is having issues.   She had been suffering from back pain for sometime and finally on Dec. 19th went to docs.  Xray led to MRI, MRI led to the mammo, ultra sound and bone scan.  Bone scans show it has progressed to bones and mammo showed mass in right breast.  I keep telling her this is doable but I guess I want to hear from you ladies if that is true or is it going to depend on how extensive bone mets are - which we don't know yet.  She has appt. with surgeon on Monday so I'll assume we will have more information at that point.  If they do offer her treatment will the treatment help her with the back pain?  Would appreciate any feedback you can offer...you girls and all the peeps on this board really rock.  Thank you, Katie    It is okay to have a bad day.....just don't string them together! Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2014 02:51PM katyand4 wrote: Thanks ladies appreciate the input.  I guess having been thru this already and reading the stories from you ladies here on the boards I feel that is it very doable but I also don't want to get the hopes up of my siblings and my children who sadly had just gotten back on track after my go round with treatment in 2011-2012.  Would you think that if it were in the organs doc would have said that to mom as well when she told her the news earlier?     Mom is 73 and dealing with high blood pressure at the moment so I'm a little concerned about that as well but for right now I will focus on the "doable" part and getting her to her next appt. with surgeon on Monday.  I will certainly encourage her to join.  Be well and stay warm.

Posts.Content: katyand4 wrote:   Ugh...very long couple of weeks ladies.  Started week before X-mas and it has been down hill since.  My mom has been diagnosed with stage IV breast cancer.  Mets to hips, spines and femur were mentioned and also couple lesions showed up in the liver.  Already started her on letrozole and monthly infusions of zometa.  Pain pills and lidocaine patches are helping to control the pain.   Hoping she has as much good fortune as some of those amazing ladies on the stage iv boards.  Mom lives with me and I think I've been more exhausted these past couple weeks then I was going thru treatment myself.  Cancer sucks...Katie  It is okay to have a bad day.....just don't string them together! Posts.Content: katyand4 wrote: My mom has been diagnosed with IV breast cancer (unofficially).  She was suffering from back pain for quite some time and went to docs week before xmas.  They did xray, xray led to MRI and then they did mammo, ultrasound and bone scan.  Extensive mets seen on bone scan along with mass in right breast.  Knew she was having back issues but quite honestly never registered that it might be breast cancer that spread.  Kicking myself now that we didn't get her to docs sooner.  Mom lives with me, kids and hubby.  We have just recovered from my own treatment that was finished in 2012 and now here we go again.  I am watching my biggest fear play out right before my very eyes....scared for my mom, scared for me and so scared for my kids.  Siblings don't realize how close to home this is hitting, trying to keep mom healthy (in so much pain with back), trying to keep myself healthy, raise four kids (24, 22, 19 & 11)  and a nephew (19), do the books for our business and keep hubby happy. My big kids have been wonderful but still feeling like way too much on the plate...you girls get how I'm feeling.  Please say a prayer for my mom...meeting with my oncologist today see where we go from there.  Be well.  Katie It is okay to have a bad day.....just don't string them together! Posts.Content: katyand4 wrote: Well ladies today I am one year survivor of breast cancer!  I'll consider this my anniversary since today is the day surgeon had to go back in to get those clear margins.  Wow what a difference a year makes, hair is back and very curl and life went on.  I'm not sure my family will realize how important this day is to me cause in the end as much as I love them they just don't understand what I'm feeling or the fear I live in.  I'm pretty sure their belief is well treatment complete so she's all good now.  But I know all the ladies here get it so that is why I'm posting.  Love this board and you ladies on here and especially the inspiring stories and long term survivors.  Katy   It is okay to have a bad day.....just don't string them together!
